titles.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2) to amend title XXI of the Social Security Act to extend and improve the Childrens's Health Insurance Program, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2) to amend title XXI of the Social Security Act to extend and improve the Childrens's Health Insurance Program, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-10, by Mr. Polis (CO).

Upon the adoption of H. Res. 107, it shall be in order to take from the Speaker's table the bill H.R. 2 with the Senate amendment thereto, and for the Chair to entertain a motion to concur in the Senate amendment. The Senate amendment and the motion shall be considered as read. The motion shall be debatable for one hour.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 7.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 107.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2) to amend title XXI of the Social Security Act to extend and improve the Childrens's Health Insurance Program.
